column5: i was at le baron today looking for some drop shot stuff bought some 4" jogger worm (will these work for SMB?) and then i saw these green boogee tail with red tips, i thought they were just  some soft plastics, but after some research, they are spinnerbait trailers so i'm just wondering if anyone have tried these as drop shot baits     Thanks, and i hope everyone have a nice holiday
i have been tempted to try them as well.! would love to hear if any1 has used them ? im sure they could work.. just havnt put the time in with them

im sure they'd be ok...but the only colors ive seen were white and yellow at ours...Best thing for drop shotting at Baron Sports imo are Jackall Crosstail Shad, Berkley GULP Goby and GULP ALIVE minnows
No, that is the only plastic bait in existence that bass do not eat. Sorry. (lol)
